summary: Cyberpunk 2077 es mejor en primera persona que como tercera persona
title: Cyberpunk 2077 es mejor en primera persona que como tercera persona
body:
Con algo de suerte en #Gamescom en agosto podriamos ver #Cyberpunk2077

Una de las historias más sorprendentes del E3 2018 fue la noticia de que CD Projekt Red, muy esperado, Cyberpunk 2077 será un RPG en primera persona, no el RPG en tercera persona que los fanáticos de la serie The Witcher esperaban.

Si eres fanático de The Witcher 3,esto es una desviación del estilo de acción en tercera persona que has visto y puedo entender una decepción inicial, pero si eres…

View On WordPress

summary: Ellos son los ganadores de los Game Critics Awards 2018
title: Ellos son los ganadores de los Game Critics Awards 2018
body:
Ellos son los ganadores de los Game Critics Awards 2018

Los organizadores de los Games Critics Awards han dado a conocer a los juegos ganadores de E3 2018, destacando que Resident Evil 2 Remake ganó el premio al mejor juego del evento y que Anthem de EA y Marvel’s Spider-Man obtuvieron un par de reconocimientos cada uno.

A continuación pueden ver el listado completo de ganadores que fueron seleccionados por jueces de distintos medios de comunicación…

View On WordPress

tags: my cyberpunk 2020 character is named spin doctor
summary: I don't know about the rest of you mofos but I couldn't care less about the character being called 'V' in game. I'm going to...
body: I don’t know about the rest of you mofos but I couldn’t care less about the character being called ‘V’ in game. I’m going to make my Cyberpunk 2020 character and spend the entire game going 'V? Ah, you must mean Spin Doctor, yes I am here, hello.’

reblog.comment: I don’t know about the rest of you mofos but I couldn’t care less about the character being called ‘V’ in game. I’m going to make my Cyberpunk 2020 character and spend the entire game going 'V? Ah, you must mean Spin Doctor, yes I am here, hello.’

trail.content_raw: I don’t know about the rest of you mofos but I couldn’t care less about the character being called ‘V’ in game. I’m going to make my Cyberpunk 2020 character and spend the entire game going 'V? Ah, you must mean Spin Doctor, yes I am here, hello.’

title: Cyberpunk 2077 petition
body:
The last post was more of an update on things revolving around Cyberpunk 2077. This is a bit of a rant. 

Anyone dumb enough to think this petition will actually do anything is just that. This game has been in development for five years and has been designed from the ground up to be a FPP game. The best ya’ll are getting is a patch that greatly lessens the experience of the game as a whole because again: it was designed for the first person perspective. I checked out comments for the actual petition and it’s all whining about the expectations people put on CDPR and the game. How can people be so closed minded? Disappointed? Sure! Absolutely! But to outwardly demand changes of a game you have no hand in or claim to is just sad. This is a completely new IP unrelated to The Witcher outside of a brief reference made by Ciri. Yes, third-person RPGs are the more conventional and arguably popular. That said, let’s not act like we’ve never played an FP game, more importantly, let’s not act like we don’t have an FP game that we love.

My favorite defense is “ I don’t want this game to be CoD!” my dude if that’s the first and only game that comes to mind you need to get your hands on more games. That’s pathetic at best and I’ll tell you why. Bioshock, Borderlands, The Darkness, Deus Ex, Dishonored, FallOut, Metro, Rainbow Six Siege, Resident Evil 7, Shadow Warrior 2, Wolfenstein are all FPP games that go in the way of RPGs in some form or fashion. The other thing they do well is not being relatable to CoD in any way outside of holding a gun and being in the first person. Even the closest example in Siege presents a level of precision that CoD doesn’t offer. Something that CDPR can take from and give to players that don't just want to pull a trigger, they want to hold a corner and peak into a bottleneck to pick off oncoming enemies. I understand those are the very sharp and intense mechanics that people that sign this petition are worried about but I don’t see why when It’s been noted that there are guns for people who aren’t the best at these types of games. With those precautions in mind, I’d think it would quell some of the concerns people have. This isn’t an FP game by Activision or EA. This is CDPR and they are going to put love and attention into these systems the same way they did The Witcher. Why not at least give them a chance?

“Oh but I spend all this time customizing my character I’ll never see them” Yeah because cutscenes and environmental design aren’t a thing. I’m sure you’ll never ever a break in gameplay and you’ll be locked there for your entire gameplay. There could be a cover system for all we know. Do you really think the studio that had the forethought to sneak a Cyberpunk reference into their previous game wouldn’t consider that issue? I realize that’s assuming a bit but do you see what I’m getting at? How methodical this studio is down to the announcement of their new game; surely this has been considered. 

In short: motion sickness is the only excuse I’ll even pretend to listen to as far as reasons for this change are concerned. Everyone else is butthurt they put unwarranted expectations on this game. CDPR are artists, let them do their thing and try and do something new. Change is scary but this is taking it a bit far.

summary:
Cyberpunk 2077 and Knee-Jerkism 

There should be no basis for expectations beyond the fact that CD Projekt Red is a top-tier...
caption:
Cyberpunk 2077 and Knee-Jerkism

There should be no basis for expectations beyond the fact that CD Projekt Red is a top-tier developer of role-playing games. Yet, many of us have decided that it’s appropriate to throw a tantrum online because Cyberpunk 2077 isn’t following the Witcher as closely as we’d like. 

Read more!

https://www.hardcoregamer.com/2018/06/30/cyberpunk-2077-and-knee-jerkism/304242/
